column5: i have to admit Connie, v-bay gord did show me some spots to try for walleye on eagle and i did get fish in a couple of those spots. maybe eagle is a dead sea where my fishing partners keep going, they just seem to be crappy guides.hope you have a great trip Connie and if you get a chance stop by
Don't know about cleaning fish but he'll eat his fair share, sure hope he can swing it
Don't ruin the poor kid on his first trip there Golden Eagle! Be gentle......Pooch

Cabin #2 on Little Vermilion Lake, a short flight north of Red Lake is booked in my name for the walleye opener. I emailed 6 guys and got a yes from 4 in under 51 minutes. Should be hearing from the two stragglers before the end of the day.It's nice dealing with friends who eliminate the guess work. This will be my 29th consecutive walleye opener on Little Vermilion. Should be getting the hang of it one of these days.
for the New Year! Have a great trip! You can start your countdown!
trying to get my guys together and looking at some dates --- gettin' fishy itchey
Getting responses that fast is equivalent of catching a 30" Walleye, it's rare.
Only one vacant seat as of last night.
29 in a row Connie? You're an inspiration.

sorry about not getting back to you sooner Connie, I think you must have my old email address but in any case i think i have to work that weekend, but if i am off i will probably be chasing my boat shadow around on the dead sea called Eagle Lake.
Bill, don't you have your own streak going on Eagle? Thought you had already turned your work boots into fishing boots.
Maybe Bill should book a cabin at VBL so I can teach him how to catch a walleye on Eagle Lake.......

The final candidate for our party is a first timer and the young son of one of our regulars. We seasoned fishermen need an infusion of young talent in our cabin. Must have a sharp filet knife and fresh legs.
